The serum comes in a convenient pump bottle, so all you have to do is pump a little onto your fingertips and gently massage it into your scalp. It’s concentrated, so a little bit goes a long way. There’s a slight tingling when it’s first applied to let you know it’s working. It’s not an unpleasant feeling at all. The serum has a light scent to it, though not offensive, and it dissipates as the product is absorbed. The serum can be used once or twice a day and the more frequently you use it, the quicker you'll see results. There are directions on the back of the bottle, but basically just massage it into your scalp. It doesn’t matter if your hair is wet or dry when you apply it and the formula is non-greasy, so your hair will still look and feel clean after you use it. Like any hair restoration product, it should be used daily for an extended period of time. Results might take a while depending on the degree of your hair loss. Besides stimulating hair follicles to produce new hair, it also adds fulness and body to any remaining hair that you have. The formula is effective for men or women. Having fine hair, I'm prone to flyaways, but this serum has given me a little extra control without weighing my hair down too much.
